description: VibeCord MVP - Discord-like chat app with login, servers, channels, and realtime messaging using Vite + TanStack Start + Tailwind + Convex + Bun + TypeScript.

userStories.title: Bootstrap project foundation
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a clean TypeScript-first project setup so feature work is consistent and fast.
acceptanceCriteria: Initialize app with Vite + TanStack Start + TypeScript
Configure Tailwind CSS and confirm styles render
Set up Convex project and connect frontend to backend
Use Bun for install and script execution
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Create account with loginName/password
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want to create an account with a login name and password so I can access the app.
acceptanceCriteria: Register page supports loginName + password
Register mutation creates user record in Convex
Password is stored as secure hash (not plain text)
Duplicate loginName is rejected with clear error
Successful registration creates authenticated session
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Login and logout
userStories.description: As a returning user, I want to login and logout securely.
acceptanceCriteria: Login page authenticates loginName + password
Invalid credentials return safe generic error
Session is persisted and checked on protected routes
Logout clears session and redirects to login
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Social auth extension points
userStories.description: As a product owner, I want the auth architecture ready for Google/GitHub/social providers later without rewriting core auth.
acceptanceCriteria: Login/register UI shows social provider placeholders
Data model includes provider account linking shape
Auth boundaries allow future OAuth integration
No working OAuth flow required in MVP
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Create and list servers
userStories.description: As an authenticated user, I want to create servers and see my server list.
acceptanceCriteria: User can create server with a name
Server creator is stored as owner
Created server appears in server list immediately
Only authenticated users can create/list servers
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Join and leave servers
userStories.description: As a user, I want to join or leave servers so I can manage communities I belong to.
acceptanceCriteria: User can join server by server id or invite placeholder flow
Joined servers appear in user's server list
User can leave server they are a member of
Server membership checks enforced in Convex
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Delete server
userStories.description: As a server owner, I want to delete my server when it is no longer needed.
acceptanceCriteria: Server owner can delete server
Non-owner cannot delete server
Deleting server removes or archives related channels/messages according to defined behavior
UI updates to remove deleted server from lists
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Create and delete channels
userStories.description: As a server member with permission, I want to create and delete channels to organize topics.
acceptanceCriteria: Create channel within selected server
Delete channel with permission checks
Only server members can list channels
Channel list updates in realtime
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Send messages in channels
userStories.description: As a server member, I want to send messages in a channel chat.
acceptanceCriteria: Message input sends message to selected channel
Message list renders author, content, and timestamp
Messages are displayed in chronological order
Only channel-accessible members can send/read messages
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Delete messages
userStories.description: As a user, I want to delete my messages (and allow moderation rules) to manage chat content.
acceptanceCriteria: Message author can delete their own message
Server owner/admin override behavior is defined and enforced
Deleted messages are removed or marked deleted per chosen UX
Unauthorized delete attempts are rejected
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Build app shell and route flow
userStories.description: As an authenticated user, I want a clear interface to navigate servers, channels, and chat.
acceptanceCriteria: Routes include /login, /register, and authenticated app routes
Authenticated shell includes server list, channel list, and chat pane
Route parameters drive selected server and channel
Empty states for no servers/channels/messages
Layout works on desktop and mobile
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Authorization and security baseline
userStories.description: As a product owner, I need baseline security so user and server data stays protected.
acceptanceCriteria: All protected Convex mutations/queries enforce auth checks
Membership checks exist for server/channel/message access
Session tokens are stored securely (hashed or equivalent)
Input validation exists for all public mutations
Basic login/register rate limiting strategy defined and implemented or documented
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Replace ESLint with Oxlint
userStories.description: As a developer, I want Oxlint to be the primary style checker so linting is faster and simpler.
acceptanceCriteria: Remove ESLint dependencies and configuration from the repo
Add Oxlint dependency and lint script using Bun
Lint command runs successfully on the TypeScript codebase
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Automate checks with GitHub Actions
userStories.description: As a maintainer, I want CI automation so pull requests are validated automatically for quality gates.
acceptanceCriteria: Create GitHub Actions workflow for pull_request and push
Workflow runs bun install, typecheck, lint, test, and build
Workflow fails when any required check fails
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Redesign app shell with dark theme
userStories.description: As an authenticated user, I want a dark three-pane chat layout with an icon server rail so navigation feels modern and focused.
acceptanceCriteria: App shell uses server icon rail, channel list, and message pane layout
UI theme is dark and readable across auth and app views
Layout remains usable on desktop and mobile
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Server-first channel routing behavior
userStories.description: As a user, I want selecting a server to open the first available channel automatically so chat is immediately accessible.
acceptanceCriteria: Selecting any server routes to that server's first channel when available
Invalid server or channel route params recover to a valid selection
Empty channel states are handled without broken navigation
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Friends and mutual request flow
userStories.description: As a user, I want to send and accept friend requests so direct messaging is only available to confirmed friends.
acceptanceCriteria: User can send friend request by login name
Recipient can accept or decline request
Duplicate, self, and invalid requests are rejected safely
Accepted friendships are queryable for UI
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Direct messages via Friends server
userStories.description: As a user, I want a special Friends server where each friend appears as a DM channel.
acceptanceCriteria: Friends entry appears first in server icon rail
Each accepted friend has a dedicated DM channel
Only friendship participants can read and send DM messages
DM list and messages update in realtime
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Settings page for management actions
userStories.description: As a user, I want management actions moved into settings so chat screens stay focused on conversation.
acceptanceCriteria: Add settings route in authenticated app
Move server and channel management controls into settings
Main chat view keeps only navigation and messaging interactions
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Regression coverage for new collaboration flows
userStories.description: As a maintainer, I want stronger automated coverage for navigation, friends, and direct messaging so releases remain stable.
acceptanceCriteria: Add tests for server selection, channel fallback, and DM access rules
Validation includes bun run typecheck, bun run lint, bun run test, and bun run build
Document any missing scripts or equivalents in PR notes
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Dismiss modals on outside click
userStories.description: As a user, I want modal dialogs to close when I click outside them so they feel natural and easy to dismiss.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking the overlay outside an open modal closes it
Clicking inside modal content does not close it
Keyboard and pointer interactions remain usable after dismissal
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Move sidebar actions into modals
userStories.description: As a user, I want non-essential sidebar controls hidden behind modal actions so the shell stays focused.
acceptanceCriteria: Remove extra chat management widgets from the visible sidebar
Expose equivalent actions through one or more modal entry points
Core navigation remains available without opening modals
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Show message delete action on hover
userStories.description: As a user, I want the message delete button hidden until hover so the message list feels cleaner.
acceptanceCriteria: Delete button is hidden by default on each message row
Delete button appears on hover/focus for accessible interaction
Delete permissions still enforce existing auth rules
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Remove message timestamps from chat view
userStories.description: As a user, I want a simpler conversation view without per-message timestamps in the message list.
acceptanceCriteria: Message timestamps are removed from the rendered chat list
Message author and content remain clearly visible
No regression in message ordering or realtime updates
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Inline send control with icon
userStories.description: As a user, I want the send action beside the message input with a simple icon so composing feels faster.
acceptanceCriteria: Send control is placed inline beside the message input
Control uses a simple icon-based affordance
Submitting by button and keyboard still works
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Split up the App.tsx file
userStories.description: As a developer, I am having a lot of issues figuring out how the app is structured since everying is in one file. Also Everything keeps breaking on PRs since there are always merge conflicts
acceptanceCriteria: Each component inside App.tsx is in it's own file
Components are grouped locally
Data fetching is done where closest to the related component
Typecheck passes
